org.nise.ux.asl.run

Class ServiceServerBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.nise.ux.asl.run.ServiceServerBuilder

  • public class ServiceServerBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the Main Constructor Class of this service library.
    To use this library create an instance of this class, then use create() to start the service
    Example:
    ServiceServerBuilder server = new ServiceServerBuilder(15015);
    server.addWorkerFactory(new WorkerFactory() {
       @Override
       public Worker getWorker() {
          return new Worker();
       }
    }, "worker1");
    server.addWorkerFactory(new WorkerFactory() {
       @Override
       public Worker getWorker() {
          return new Worker2();
       }
    }, "worker2");
    ServiceServer serviceServer = server.create();
    Author:
    Yaser Eftekhari ( ^ - ^ )
    See Also:
    WorkerFactory, Worker, MapCommand, CommandChain

      ServiceServerBuilder addWorkerFactory(WorkerFactory workerFactory, java.lang.String name)

      Adds workers generated from this factory right after workers of name {parentName}
      ServiceServer create()
      Creates a server listening on defined LISTENING_PORT
      ServiceServerBuilder setAutoFetcherNo(int lower_bound, int upper_bound)
      Set value of configuration for request_fetcher_no with automatic management with lower/upper bands specified.

      Set value of configuration for {worker}_no with automatic management with lower/upper bands specified.
